snippet: Residents and civic leaders are upset that they cannot get answers to their questions about the shooting and the investigation.
abstract: Members of Trenton, NJ, community where 14-year-old Radazz Hearns was shot by police are questioning officers' assertion that Hearns was carrying gun at time of confrontation; officers claim Hearns, who is black, had reached into his waistband in threatening manner, but lawyer for teenager's family says no gun was found near scene and that handgun showing up 12 hours later was not near path of boy's flight from officers.
lead_paragraph: Residents and civic leaders are upset that they cannot get answers to their questions about the shooting and the investigation.

headline.main: Community Seeks Answers After Officers Shoot Trenton Boy
headline.print_headline: Community Seeks Answers After Officers Shoot Trenton Boy
